detaileddescription.para: Constants defining the maximum initial size of the window.
Constant defining the "speed" at which to zoom in and out.
The total number of created Windows. If this ever reaches 0 (apart from the beginning), quit the server.
The top level layer we add our PNodes to (root node).
The current color of the pen. It is used to draw edges, text, etc.
The current color of the brush. It is used to draw the interior of primitives.
The system name of the current font we are using (e.g. "Times New Roman").
The stroke width to be used.
A unique representation for the window, also known by the client. It is used when sending messages from server to client to identify him.
The Canvas, MessageBox, EventHandler, Menubar and Popupmenu associated with this window.
Set the brush to an RGB color

memberdef.argsstring: (int red, int green, int blue, int alpha)
memberdef.name: brush

detaileddescription.para: Set the brush to an RGBA color
Erase all content from the window, but do not destroy it.

memberdef.argsstring: (String internalName, int width, int height, int bitsPerPixel)
memberdef.name: createImage

detaileddescription.para: Start setting up a new image. The server will now expect image data until the image is complete.

parameterdescription.para: The unique name of the new image

detaileddescription.para: Start setting up a new polyline. The server will now expect polyline data until the polyline is complete.
Draw the now complete polyline.

memberdef.argsstring: (String name, int hash, int posX, int posY, int sizeX, int sizeY, int canvasSizeX, int canvasSizeY)
memberdef.name: SVWindow

detaileddescription.para: Construct a new SVWindow and set it visible.

parameterdescription.para: Unique internal representation. This has to be the same as defined by the client, as they use this to refer to the windows.
X position of where to draw the window (upper left).
Y position of where to draw the window (upper left).
The canvas width of the window.
The canvas height of the window.

detaileddescription.para: Convenience function to add a message box to the window which can be used to output debug information.

Allows you to specify the thickness with which to draw lines, recantgles and ellipses.
width
The new thickness.

memberdef.argsstring: (int x, int y, int width, int height)
memberdef.name: drawEllipse

detaileddescription.para: Draw an ellipse at (x,y) with given width and height, using the current stroke, the current brush color to fill it and the current pen color for the outline.
Draw the image with the given name at (x,y). Any image loaded stays in memory, so if you intend to redraw an image, you do not have to use createImage again.

memberdef.argsstring: (int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
memberdef.name: drawLine

detaileddescription.para: Draw a line from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2) using the current pen color and stroke.

memberdef.argsstring: (int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
memberdef.name: drawRectangle

detaileddescription.para: Draw a rectangle given the two points (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) using the current stroke, pen color for the border and the brush to fill the interior.

Draw some text at (x,y) using the current pen color and text attributes. If the current font does NOT support at least one character, it tries to find a font which is capable of displaying it and use that to render the text. Note: If the font says it can render a glyph, but in reality it turns out to be crap, there is nothing we can do about it.
Set the pen color to an RGB value

memberdef.argsstring: (int red, int green, int blue, int alpha)
memberdef.name: pen

detaileddescription.para: Set the pen color to an RGBA value

memberdef.argsstring: (String font, int pixelSize, boolean bold, boolean italic, boolean underlined)
memberdef.name: textAttributes

detaileddescription.para: Define how to display text. Note: underlined is not currently not supported

memberdef.argsstring: (int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
memberdef.name: zoomRectangle

detaileddescription.para: Zoom the window to the rectangle given the two points (x1,y1) and (x2,y2), which must be greater than (x1,y1).
Flush buffers and update display.
Only actually reacts if there are no more messages in the stack, to prevent the canvas from flickering.

memberdef.argsstring: (String parent, String name, int id, boolean checked)
memberdef.name: addMenuBarItem

detaileddescription.para: Adds a checkbox entry to the menubar, c.f. SVMenubar.add(...)
Adds a submenu to the menubar, c.f. SVMenubar.add(...)
Adds a new entry to the menubar, c.f. SVMenubar.add(...)
Add a message to the message box.

memberdef.argsstring: (String msg, String def, int id, SVEventType evtype)
memberdef.name: showInputDialog

detaileddescription.para: Show a modal input dialog. The answer by the dialog is then send to the client, together with the associated menu id, as SVET_POPUP

parameterdescription.para: The text that is displayed in the dialog.
The default value of the dialog.
The event this is associated with (usually SVET_MENU or SVET_POPUP)

detaileddescription.para: Shows a modal input dialog to the user. The return value is automatically sent to the client as SVET_INPUT event (with command id -1).
Shows a dialog presenting "Yes" and "No" as answers and returns either a "y" or "n" to the client.

parameterdescription.para: The text that is displayed in the dialog.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a submenu to the popup menu, c.f. SVPopupMenu.add(...)

memberdef.argsstring: (String parent, String name, int cmdEvent, String value, String desc)
memberdef.name: addPopupMenuItem

detaileddescription.para: Adds a new menu entry to the popup menu, c.f. SVPopupMenu.add(...)
Destroys a window.
Open an image from a given file location and store it in memory. Pro: Faster than createImage. Con: Works only on the local file system.
This method converts a string which might contain hexadecimal values to a string which contains the respective unicode counterparts.
For example, Hall0x0094chen returns Hall<o umlaut>chen encoded as utf8.

simplesect.para: The converted string which has the replaced unicode symbols

detaileddescription.para: The SVWindow is the top-level ui class. It should get instantiated whenever the user intends to create a new window. It contains helper functions to draw on the canvas, add new menu items, show modal dialogs etc.
